q: Whats's the main purpose of Fosto?
a: Fosto is designed in an effort to help solve the problem of not having a universal lost and found application for the general community.

Users of Fosto are given two options when they first enter the website. A Lost and Found section. They can either click on the lost section to describe an item they found, or click on a found item to connect to the person that lost it, and create a listing on the map that would show up as a pin-drop.

q: How long does a user created listing last?
a: It lasts for 10 days. Users have the option to renew their listing if they want an extension.

q: What are some ways a user can communicate with the person that lost or found an item?
a: They can use a Live chat system or an email to communicate with another user.

q: When happens when a user finds an item?
a: They can drop off at a closeby institution or a government agency, and create a listing on the map.

q: When happens when a user loses an item?
a: They can create a listing on the map to ask other users to help find it. In return they can provide some sort of a reward.
